Week of July 14, 2014 <https://www.google.com/url?q=http://v2.decipherinc.com/survey/selfserve/1510/140609?utm_source%3DPivotal%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_campaign%3DPaaSQ32014&sa=D&usg=ALhdy2-BPJYJ_wVy8r0xTZ4aLYjjppuzVA> SURVEY: APPLICATION DEVELOPMENT AND PLATFORM-AS-A-SERVICE Leading analyst firm Enterprise Management Associates (EMA) is researching trends in application development and Platform-as-a-Service. Please share your experience and in return get the report to see how your dev and IT team peers are dealing with the new challenges and opportunities of building cloud apps. START SURVEY <https://www.google.com/url?q=http://v2.decipherinc.com/survey/selfserve/1510/140609?utm_source%3DPivotal%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_campaign%3DPaaSQ32014&sa=D&usg=ALhdy2-BPJYJ_wVy8r0xTZ4aLYjjppuzVA> PAAS COMPARISON: CLOUD FOUNDRY, MICROSOFT AZURE, GOOGLE APP ENGINE, AMAZON, HEROKU, AND OPENSHIFT <http://blog.gopivotal.com/cloud-foundry-pivotal/features/paas-comparison-cloud-foundry-microsoft-azure-google-app-engine-amazon-heroku-and-openshift> One of the most popular talks at CF Summit <https://2014.event.cfsummit.com/schedule/5362893cecdcc4fb6a000007> was based on the work done by Dr. Mike Maximilien <https://2014.event.cfsummit.com/presenters/michael_maximilien.html> from IBM Cloud Labs and James Bayer <https://2014.event.cfsummit.com/presenters/james_bayer.html>, Pivotal’s Cloud Foundry’s Director of Product Management. The two shared research to date done to compare Cloud Foundry, Microsoft Azure, Google App Engine, Amazon, Heroku, and OpenShift. Detail included formalized matrices comparing 50 features as well as qualitative feedback on what works well and not so well.
READ MORE… <http://blog.gopivotal.com/cloud-foundry-pivotal/features/paas-comparison-cloud-foundry-microsoft-azure-google-app-engine-amazon-heroku-and-openshift> MONSANTO SEES 50% APP DEV LIFECYCLE IMPROVEMENT WITH CLOUD FOUNDRY <http://blog.gopivotal.com/cloud-foundry-pivotal/case-studies-2/monsanto-sees-50-app-dev-lifecycle-improvement-with-cloud-foundry> As shared at the recent Cloud Foundry Summit <http://cfsummit.com>, Monsanto sees huge benefits with Cloud Foundry <http://cloudfoundry.org/index.html>. From increased efficiency and productivity to less finger pointing between developers and operations, Infrastructure Architect, Mark Seidenstricker <https://2014.event.cfsummit.com/presenters/mark_seidenstricker.html>, shares the insights and learnings from their journey with Cloud Foundry, lists many benefits, discusses cultural and change management shifts in IT, and outlines their future plans.
